forumNotes.author: Robekia
forumNotes.content:
Can you help me please?  

I have HP labtop (HP530).  
my Stick (Kingston Data traveller 120) 8GB.  
Booting through GRUB is OK.  
choose to go with Text Mode, gives Bank screen with Blinking Cursor on left top side ......

forumNotes.author: Robekia
forumNotes.content:
I have HP530 Labtop.  
I have Memory sticks (kingston 2GB and Kingston 8GB) used for tests.  
I tried to install windows XP SP3 using CD (Success).  
When i tried USB_MultiBoot_10 procedures using the mentioned Sticks, everything went fine and the labtop boots to Grub just fine.  
I choose to go with the the TEXT mode from the options in Boot.ini, but unfortunately it gives Blank screen with Blinking Cursor at the left top side.  

I tried the same Sticks with AsusEee (Success).  
I tried the same Sticks with Acer5738 (Success).  
I tried the same Sticks with Acer1640 (Success).  

Is there any chance to success with this solution on HP labtops?

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Is there any chance to success with this solution on HP labtops?

Yes, and you have ALREADY been told how.  
[http://www.msfn.org/...nt-t133086.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/solved-problem-hp-equipment-t133086.html "External link")  
[http://www.msfn.org/...h...10.html\&hl=](http://www.msfn.org/board/solved-problem-hp-equipment-t133086-page-10.html&hl= "External link")  

DO NOT USE the HP Format tool!  

Use RMPREPUSB or FBINST.  

OR try using fuwi's tool.  

AND STOP double posting, NOW! ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)   

jaclaz
